Name: Triple statuette of Osiris
Description: The group consists of three figures of Osiris standing on a common flat base with three tenons. In either case the body is enveloped in a tightly fitting mummy gown leaving exposed only the hands holding a crook and a flail; the god wears an atef-crown with an uraeus, but without horns, and a pleated artificial beard. The quality of work is very poor.
